titleproper.value:
Guide to the South Brooklyn Savings Bank records
                    <num>2007.001</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik and John Zarrillo

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2015-06-04T11:26-0400</date>

extent.value: in 19 boxes of various sizes and five loose objects

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The collection consists of the records of the Board of Trustees of the South Brooklyn Savings Bank (originally known as the South Brooklyn Savings Institution, and later known as the Independence Savings Bank and the Independence Community Bank). These records include Board meeting minutes, financial records and reports, administrative files, photographs, scrapbooks, and memorabilia. The records span the entire history of the bank, from its founding in 1850 through 2006 (the year the bank was acquired by Sovereign Bank).

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); South Brooklyn Savings Bank records, 2007.001, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Gift of Independence Community Bank Corp., 2007.

The South Brooklyn Savings Institution was founded in Brooklyn, New York, in 1850. The institution formally changed its name to the South Brooklyn Savings Bank in 1930. The bank's main branch was located at the corner of Atlantic Avenue and Court Street. Another major branch was located at 18th Avenue and 65th Street. The bank expanded throughout the 20th century, with offices located in Brooklyn, Queens, Manhattan, the Bronx, and Nassau County, New York. In 1975, the bank formally changed its name to the Independence Savings Bank. In 1992, "the bank reorganized into [a] mutual holding company." The bank underwent further reorganization in 1997, and formally changed its name to Independence Community Bank Corp. In 2006, the bank was acquired by Sovereign Bancorp, Inc.

The collection consists of the records of the Board of Trustees of the South Brooklyn Savings Bank (originally known as the South Brooklyn Savings Institution, and later known as the Independence Savings Bank and the Independence Community Bank). These records include Board meeting minutes, financial records and reports, administrative files, photographs, scrapbooks, and memorabilia. The records span the entire history of the bank, from its founding in 1850 through 2006 (the year the bank was acquired by Sovereign Bank).

dsc.value:
Series 1: Board of Trustees meeting minutes 1850-1966 Scope and Contents

The series contains four bound volumes of Board of Trustee meeting minutes (1850-1935) and two bound volumes of Executive Committee meeting minutes (1877-1966), which document the decision-making and policies which led to the bank's success and expansion from 1850 to 1966.

 Board of Trustees meeting minutes (2 volumes) 14 - 1850-1917 Board of Trustees meeting minutes 13 - 1917-1933 Board of Trustees meeting minutes 9 - 1933-1935 Executive Committee meeting minutes 9 - 1877-1920 Executive Committee meeting minutes 8 - 1958-1966 Series 2: Financial records 1850-2000 Scope and Contents

The series contains financial records and reports dating from 1850 to 2000. It includes financial ledgers (1850-1944), tax documents (1922-1934, 1952-1954), Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation reports (1953-1975), reports to the Board of Trustees (1958-1981), and financial statements (1960-1992, 2000).

 Arrangement note

The series is generally arranged chronologically by date.

 Monthly Reports ledger 12 - 1850-1901 Organizational and financial ledger 10 - circa 1895-1931 General note

Ledger contains a mix of organizational and financial records. The following items are listed in its index: Organization of bank, Trustees when elected, Offices, Interest to depositors, Panics, Amount due depositors, Bonds and mortgages, Employees of bank, Finances committees, Executive committees, Examining committees, Interest on securities, and Receipt and payments from 1850

 Financial journal 12 - 1933 Petty Cash ledger 9 - 1933-1934 Daily Record ledger 11 - 1944 Daily Record ledger 11 - 1946 Expense journal - Tax subdivision - Bank buildings and operation 9 - 1944 Tax documents 3 1 1923-1934 U.S. Corporate Federal Income Tax Returns 3 2 1952-1954 FDIC reports and working papers (5 folders) 3 3-7 1943-1971 FDIC reports and working papers (8 folders) 4 1-8 1969-1975 Reports (5 folders) 5 1-5 1958-1981 Financial statements 5 6 1960-1992, 2000 Series 3: Administrative files 1883-2006 Scope and Contents

The series represents a small collection of files which were produced by the Board of Trustees and various administrative departments throughout the history of the bank, dating from 1883 to 2006.

It contains property titles (1886-1892), public relations and advertising files (1937-2005), building and renovation files (1930-1964), copies of 1850 and 1859 articles of incorporaton, one file on the 2006 acquisition of the Independence Community Bank Corporation by Sovereign Bancorp, Inc., and other documents.

 Arrangement note

The series is arranged chronologically by date.

 Correspondence with NY State Superintendent of Banking Department 1 1 1883 Property titles 1 2 1886-1892 Organizational and financial ledger 10 - circa 1895-1931 General note

Ledger contains a mix of organizational and financial records. The following items are listed in its index: Organization of bank, Trustees when elected, Offices, Interest to depositors, Panics, Amount due depositors, Bonds and mortgages, Employees of bank, Finances committees, Executive committees, Examining committees, Interest on securities, and Receipt and payments from 1850

 Branch Authorizations 1 3 1930, 1957 Ephemera 1 4 1936-1961 Public Relations manual 1 5 1937 Publications 1 5 1945-1952 Dormant Account Methods and Procedures survey 1 5 1946 A Study Relating to the Monthly Publication of the South Brooklyn Savings Bank 1 6 1947 Retirement System 2 1 1947 Advertising - 100th Anniversary 2 2 1949-1950 Educational materials 2 3 1952 Completed contracts 2 4 1952-1958 Building Committee 2 5 1957-1969 1850 Act of Incorporation, 1859 amendment, and 1930 name change certificates 2 6 1958 Main office alterations 2 7 1964 Mike Armstrong - Advertising files 2 8 1975-2005 Financial planning 2 9 2006 Stockholders - Merger meeting 2 10 2006 Series 4: Photographs and Scrapbooks 1883-2001 Scope and Contents

The series contains photographs and scrapbooks documenting the bank from 1883 to 2001.

It includes numerous photographic portraits of bank trustees, in three albums, five folders, and one framed photograph (circa 1940-2001). Additionally, the series contains two scrapbooks documenting the lives of trustees (1922-1982).

It contains two clippings scrapbooks (1883-1920) and five advertising scrapbooks (1931-1953).

Other photographs include bank baseball teams (circa 1930), the corner of Atlantic Avenue and Court Street (circa 1920), the bank's 90th anniversary (1940), Christmas celebrations (1951-1952), and bank openings (circa 1960).

 Corner of Atlantic Avenue and Court Street photographs 17 - circa 1920 South Brooklyn Savings Bank baseball team 6 1 circa 1930 90th anniversary photographs 17 - 1940 Bank opening photographs (2 folders) 6 2-3 circa 1960 Christmas photographs 6 4 1951-1952 Board of Trustees portraits (3 folders) 6 5-7 1959-1979, 2001 Board of Trustees oversize portraits 17 - 1970s Board of Trustees group photograph 6 8 1975 Trustees at NASDAQ MarketSite, Times Square (framed) 16 - circa 2000 Board of Trustees portrait albums (3 albums) 7 - circa 1940-1972 General note

Albums feature portraits of Board of Trustees dating back to 1850. The first and second albums appear to have been created around 1940, with additional material added to the albums until around 1972.

 Board of Trustees scrapbooks (2 scrapbooks) 8 - 1922-1982 Clippings scrapbook 8 - 1883-1923 Clippings scrapbook 10 - 1917-1918 Advertising scrapbook 16 - 1931-1937 Advertising and publicity scrapbook 15 - 1943-1949 Advertising scrapbooks (3 scrapbooks) 15 - 1951-1953 Series 5: Memorabilia circa 1920s-2004 Scope and Contents

The series contains bank memorabilia, dating from around the 1920s to 2004. It primarily consists of objects relating the bank's sports teams, including trophies for Brooklyn bank baseball, basketball, and bowling leagues (1930s and 1970s). Other objects include a wood block stamp of the bank's 18th Avenue branch building (circa 1920s-1940s), radio advertisment 12" vinyl records (circa 1950s), advertising awards (1970s), and paperweights commemorating the bank's stock valuations (1992-2004).

 Arrangement note

The series is generally arranged chronologically by date.

 South Brooklyn Savings Bank 18th Avenue office building wood block stamp 17 circa 1920s-1940s South Brooklyn Savings Bank championship team signed baseballs (2 objects) 19 1933-1934 Savings Bank Baseball League of Brooklyn trophy Artifact shelf 1933-1935 Savings Bank Baseball League of Brooklyn championship trophy Artifact shelf 1936 Savings Bank Basketball League of Brooklyn championship trophy Artifact shelf 1934-1935 Savings Bank Bowling League 2nd place trophy Artifact shelf 1976-1977 Radio advertisements 12" vinyl records (2 records) 17 circa 1950s Eighth Annual Addy Awards - 1st place certificate 16 1976 Financial Advertising and Marketing Association - Town Crier Award Artifact shelf 1975 Commemorative paperweights (10 objects) 18 1992-2004
